sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let the sets A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the set (A ⊖ B) × B and the set B × (A ⊖ B), and show that these sets are not equal, proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
